Posts.Content: deb3girls wrote: I am on my way to treatment..last week my onc. gave me a script for a pet/ct scan...first one ordered since I started treatment in january..I was called yesterday by oncology office to say that my ins. company denied authorization...they feel I should wait till I have been treated for 6 months....I am so upset over this...on one hand I want to  know if treatment is working....but got worked up over having scan...now I am so worked up "they" decide what they think is right for me...How do I fight this...or should my oncologist be fighting this for me....??? I think it is absurd that with all we have to deal with that we have to deal with obstacles like this. Where  do we get the strenght?                        Thanks...Debbie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: denial of pet/ct scan deb3girls DMike

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 07:53AM deb3girls wrote: Just a quick note to thank everyone for their input..The oncologist finally got the pet/ct scan approved~ My first since treatment began in January. I will be having it May 2nd. I sure hope this avastin/abraxane has worked its wonders...happy to be going,scared to find out results. What is the "rule of thumb" do they generally keep you on the same treatment  if it is working??
Posts.Title: denial of pet/ct scan deb3girls DMike

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 08:19AM deb3girls wrote: Hi,     I would like to share my story about my 30 year old daughter..she was just tested and came back positive. She has given me a lovely grandaughter who will be 1 this march.  I had stage 0 -15 years ago..and this november had my second bout with bc ..only this time not so "lucky". I have mets to the bone and lung. What worries me the most is my daughters now. As I said the oldest had the bracca testing. My two other daughters 25 and 28 ...not married are scared to death to have it done...and I am sure when they are ready they will. It was recommended that the oldest after having her next and last baby have her ovaries removed since I am er and pr + and then a propholatic mastectomy. She is going for another opinion to a large cancer institute in NY. I am rambling but I am so scared for my three girls and now worry so much about the two unmarried...I am thankful they have this bracca testing...and now MRI's for the young girls...
Posts.Title: Just sharing about BRCAII & Daughter KiminJax deb3girls

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 04:42AM deb3girls wrote: Lori,        My daughter, 30 yrs old sadly enough said she had been preparing for this since she was 15..when I was first diagnosed at age 37 with bc... Your absolutley right about not being out of the woods with a neg. result... Knowledge is POWER....and thats what I keep telling my daughter since her positive Bracca results...
Posts.Title: Just sharing about BRCAII & Daughter KiminJax deb3girls

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 08:09AM deb3girls wrote: Hi,        I am on abraxane and avastin..3 on and 1 week off (yippee) since January...I too get that "metallic" taste on and off. I don't know where I read to try "werthers" you know the hard butterscotch candy and it does seem to help. I also use biotene mouthwash and that seems to have helped also..                                           Debbie

Big hug~ Debbie
